usefulItems: rolling pin, pastry brush, frying pan, tongs, paper towel, round pastry cutter (Ø 10 cm), hob
title: Cheese and Walnut Patties

ingredients.content: 130 g stale bread, torn in pieces
1 tsp olive oil, plus extra for greasing
oil, for frying (e.g. sunflower or groundnut)

preparations.content: Place all breadcrumb ingredients in mixing bowl then grate <b>15 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in flour then set aside.
Place water, butter, salt and oil in mixing bowl then heat <b>5 min/100°C/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, grease a bowl.
Add reserved flour and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer to prepared bowl and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, prepare filling.
Place nuts in mixing bowl and grate <b>6 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place oil, onions and garlic in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed 1<b>.
Add curd cheese, reserved nuts, salt and pepper then mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.
Tip cooled dough out onto a work surface and roll out to 1-2 mm thick. Using a cutter (Ø 10 cm), cut out 40 circles of dough, re-rolling any trimmings as necessary.

Place 1 tsp filling in centre of each circle then brush rim of each circle with water. Fold over patty, encasing filling and removing air. Brush patties with a beaten egg then coat in reserved breadcrumbs and set aside.

Heat some oil in a large frying pan over a medium-high heat. Shallow fry patties for 2-3 minutes until cooked through and golden brown, adding oil as necessary. Drain on paper towel to remove excess oil. Serve hot or cold.
